perturbation.original_text: This Content License Agreement ("Agreement") is between Global Music International, Inc. d/b/a Independent Music Network (IMNTV), located at 20 Old Stagecoach Road, Redding, Connecticut, 06896 ("IMNTV"), and Distributor, as set forth below, and describes the terms and conditions under which Distributor will distribute Programming provided by IMNTV as described herein. Distributor's distribution of the Programming is subject to the Master Terms of Service ("MTS") attached hereto as Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: This Content License Agreement ("Agreement") is between Global Music International, Inc. d/b/a Independent Music Network (IMNTV), located at 20 Old Stagecoach Road, Redding, Connecticut, 06896 ("IMNTV"), and Licensee, as set forth below, and describes the terms and conditions under which Distributor will distribute Programming provided by IMNTV as described herein. Licensee's distribution of the Programming is subject to the Master Terms of Service ("MTS") attached hereto as Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Licensee' in the second instance. Later in the document it uses 'Distributor' as originally intended, creating a contradiction about who has the distribution rights and responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text:
"Distributor Marks" means the trademarks, service marks, brands, logos and trade names of Distributor.

"Distributor Portal" means, collectively, the Distributor's Site and any other web site or property from where Distributor promotes the Programming.

"Distributor Site" means Distributor's Internet web site intended to promote the availability of any Distributor Content, including the Programming, via mobile and wireless networks. Distributor Site is more fully described in Section A of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
"Distributor Marks" means the trademarks, service marks, brands, logos and trade names of Distributor.

"Distributor Portal" means, collectively, the Channel's Site and any other web site or property from where Distributor promotes the Programming.

"Distributor Site" means Channel's Internet web site intended to promote the availability of any Distributor Content, including the Programming, via mobile and wireless networks. Distributor Site is more fully described in Section A of the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor's Site' is changed to 'Channel's Site.' While 'Distributor' remains defined, this modification implies that 'Channel' is the entity responsible for the website. This creates confusion about which entity (Distributor or Channel) owns and operates the website where the Programming is promoted. Since 'Channel' is undefined it's difficult to decide which entity has what responsibility and control.

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 Distributor Warranty and Indemnification. Distributor represents and warrants to IMNTV that: (i) Distributor is an entity duly organized and validly existing under the laws of its country of organization; (ii) Distributor has the power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform fully its obligations under this Agreement; (iii) Distributor is under no contractual or other legal obligation which could reasonably be expected to interfere in any way with its prompt and complete performance under this Agreement; and (iv) the person executing this Agreement on behalf of Distributor has been duly authorized to do so and such execution is binding upon Distributor.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 Licensee Warranty and Indemnification. Distributor represents and warrants to IMNTV that: (i) Licensee is an entity duly organized and validly existing under the laws of its country of organization; (ii) Licensee has the power and authority to enter into this Agreement and to perform fully its obligations under this Agreement; (iii) Licensee is under no contractual or other legal obligation which could reasonably be expected to interfere in any way with its prompt and complete performance under this Agreement; and (iv) the person executing this Agreement on behalf of Licensee has been duly authorized to do so and such execution is binding upon Licensee.
perturbation.explanation: The section is renamed to 'Licensee Warranty and Indemnification,' but the subsequent text refers to 'Distributor' still having responsibility. This makes it impossible to tell whether Distributor or Licensee is responsible for ensuring and warranting these responsibilities.
